title: Ticket #1082: DAGMan VARS values cannot contain single quotes
description:
The subject line pretty much says it -- there's no way to get a single quote into a DAGMan VARS value. Fixing this won't involve just changing the DAGMan parsing code; it will have to involve at least checking that a value containing single quotes can make its way through condor_submit, the classad, and all the way to the actual binary that's being run...

Note: I'm putting a version of 7.4.1 because I'm entering the bug now, but I'm sure it's been around for years. (The restriction is documented in the manual, but I'm still considering it a bug because someone might need single quotes in a VARS value, and there's no way to work around it without avoiding the use of VARS entirely.)
remarks:
2015-Jun-10 09:45:17 by wenger:
Note: Not being able to have single quotes in the VARS string also makes it harder to define a command-line argument containing a space using VARS.
